citation.name: J. Struct. Funct. Genomics
citation.title: Solution structure of the epsin N-terminal homology (ENTH) domain of human epsin.

reference.scope: STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 1-144

comment.text: Binds to membranes enriched in phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate (PtdIns(4,5)P2). Modifies membrane curvature and facilitates the formation of clathrin-coated invaginations (By similarity). Regulates receptor-mediated endocytosis.

Monomer. Binds clathrin, ZBTB16/ZNF145 and ITSN1 (By similarity). Binds ubiquitinated proteins (By similarity). Binds REPS2, EPS15, AP2A1 and AP2A2. Interacts with RALBP1 in a complex also containing NUMB and TFAP2A during interphase and mitosis. Interacts with AP2B1. Interacts with UBQLN2.

Associated with the cytoplasmic membrane at sites where clathrin-coated pits are forming. Colocalizes with clathrin and AP-2 in a punctate pattern on the plasma membrane. Detected in presynaptic nerve terminals and in Golgi stacks. May shuttle to the nucleus when associated with ZBTB16/ZNF145 (By similarity).
The NPF repeat domain is involved in EPS15 binding.
The DPW repeat domain is involved in AP2A2 and clathrin binding.
The [DE]-X(1,2)-F-X-X-[FL]-X-X-X-R motif mediates interaction with the AP-2 complex subunit AP2B1.

Phosphorylated on serine and/or threonine residues in mitotic cells. Phosphorylation reduces interaction with REPS2, AP-2 and the membrane fraction. Depolarization of synaptosomes results in dephosphorylation.
May be due to a competing donor splice site.

comment.name: Protein Spotlight
comment.text: The bubble's bend - Issue 42 of January 2004

property.value: Expressed in body of stomach and 218 other tissues
P:negative regulation of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

feature.description: Abolishes phosphorylation by CDK1 and reduces REPS2 binding.
